answer_zh: 第三条诫命尤其警戒那些发誓、起誓和妄称上帝之名的人，以及一切亵渎上帝圣名的人。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the second commandment are, all devising, counseling, commanding, using, and any wise approving, any religious worship not instituted by God himself; the making any representation of God, of all or of any of the three persons, either inwardly in our mind, or outwardly in any kind of image or likeness of any creature whatsoever; all worshiping of it, or God in it or by it; the making of any representation of feigned deities, and all worship of them, or service belonging to them; all superstitious devices, corrupting the worship of God, adding to it, or taking from it, whether invented and taken up of ourselves, or received by tradition from others, though under the title of antiquity, custom, devotion, good intent, or any other pretense whatsoever; simony; sacrilege; all neglect, contempt, hindering, and opposing the worship and ordinances which God hath appointed.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第109题

question_zh: 第四条诫命是什么？
question_en: What are the reasons annexed to the second commandment, the more to enforce it?
answer_zh: 第四条诫命是：“当记念安息日，守为圣日。六日要劳碌做你一切的工，但第七日是向耶和华你上帝当守的安息日。这一日你和你的儿女、仆婢、牲畜，并你城里寄居的客旅，无论何工都不可做。因为六日之内，耶和华造天、地、海和其中的万物，第七日便安息，所以耶和华赐福与安息日，定为圣日。”
answer_en: The reasons annexed to the second commandment, the more to enforce it, contained in these words, For I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me; and shewing mercy unto thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments; are, besides God’s sovereignty over us, and propriety in us, his fervent zeal for his own worship, and his revengeful indignation against all false worship, as being a spiritual whoredom; accounting the breakers of this commandment such as hate him, and threatening to punish them unto divers generations; and esteeming the observers of it such as love him and keep his commandments, and promising mercy to them unto many generations.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第110题

question_zh: 第四条诫命吩咐什么？
question_en: Which is the third commandment?
answer_zh: 第四条诫命吩咐我们在上帝的话语中所规定的日子，将之按时分别为圣归给上帝；就是在七日中有一整天作为向祂守的圣安息日。
answer_en: The third commandment is, Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain: for the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第111题

question_zh: 第四条诫命要求将七日中的哪一日守为圣安息日？
question_en: What is required in the third commandment?
answer_zh: 从世界的起初到基督的复活，上帝指定每周的第七日为安息日；从那时起，直到世界的末了，就改为每周的第一日，就是基督徒的安息日，在新约中称为主日。
answer_en: The third commandment requires, that the name of God, his titles, attributes, ordinances, the word, sacraments, prayer, oaths, vows, lots, his works, and whatsoever else there is whereby he makes himself known, be holily and reverently used in thought, meditation, word, and writing; by an holy profession, and answerable conversation, to the glory of God, and the good of ourselves, and others.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第112题

question_zh: 安息日应当怎样守为圣日？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the third commandment?
answer_zh: 安息日应当整日守为圣日，以圣洁的安息为乐，不仅要停止那些在其他日子也是犯罪的事，而且要停止那些在其他日子合法的世俗工作和消遣，将全部时间（除了有必要的工作和怜悯的事以外）用于公共和私下的敬拜上帝，并用于属于这些职分的事。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the third commandment are, the not using of God’s name as is required; and the abuse of it in an ignorant, vain, irreverent, profane, superstitious, or wicked mentioning or otherwise using his titles, attributes, ordinances, or works, by blasphemy, perjury; all sinful cursings, oaths, vows, and lots; violating of our oaths and vows, if lawful; and fulfilling them, if of things unlawful; murmuring and quarreling at, curious prying into, and misapplying of God’s decrees and providences; misinterpreting, misapplying, or any way perverting the word, or any part of it, to profane jests, curious or unprofitable questions, vain janglings, or the maintaining of false doctrines; abusing it, the creatures, or anything contained under the name of God, to charms, or sinful lusts and practices; the maligning, scorning, reviling, or any wise opposing of God’s truth, grace, and ways; making profession of religion in hypocrisy, or for sinister ends; being ashamed of it, or a shame to it, by unconformable, unwise, unfruitful, and offensive walking, or backsliding from it.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第113题

question_zh: 第四条诫命禁止什么？
question_en: What reasons are annexed to the third commandment?
answer_zh: 第四条诫命禁止忽略或不认真地履行所要求的责任，以及因懈怠、或做那些本身就是犯罪的事，或因不必要的思想、言语或行为涉及世俗的职业和消遣，而亵渎这一天。
answer_en: The reasons annexed to the third commandment, in these words, The LORD thy God , and, For the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain , are, because he is the Lord and our God, therefore his name is not to be profaned, or any way abused by us; especially because he will be so far from acquitting and sparing the transgressors of this commandment, as that he will not suffer them to escape his righteous judgment, albeit many such escape the censures and punishments of men.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第114题

question_zh: 第四条诫命附加的理由是什么？
question_en: Which is the fourth commandment?
answer_zh: 第四条诫命附加的理由取自上帝给我们作工六日的公平性，祂自己为安息日定了榜样，以及祂赐福安息日。
answer_en: The fourth commandment is, Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy. Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work; but the seventh day is the sabbath of the LORD thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates. For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第115题

question_zh: 为什么要用“记念”这个词？
question_en: What is required in the fourth commandment?
answer_zh: 在第四条诫命中用“记念”这个词，一方面是因为纪念安息日大有益处，帮助我们遵守它；另一方面是因为我们极容易忘记它，因为我们自己的事务虽然在六日中有足够的时间来做，却常常侵占我们用于敬拜上帝的日子；又因为撒但和他的差役不遗余力地消除对安息日的敬重，使之在我们的记忆中变为模糊。
answer_en: The fourth commandment requireth of all men the sanctifying or keeping holy to God such set times as he hath appointed in his word, expressly one whole day in seven; which was the seventh from the beginning of the world to the resurrection of Christ, and the first day of the week ever since, and so to continue to the end of the world; which is the Christian sabbath, and in the New Testament called The Lord’s Day.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第116题

question_zh: 安息日当怎样预备？
question_en: How is the sabbath or the Lord’s day to be sanctified?
answer_zh: 安息日当以整天的圣洁安息来预备，就是甚至要休息那些在其他日子是合法的世俗事务以及消遣活动；除了有必要的事和怜悯的事以外；并将这一天全部的时间用于公共的和私人的敬拜上帝的操练上；因此我们必须预备心灵，安排好一切普通的事务，提前做好准备。
answer_en: The sabbath or Lord’s day is to be sanctified by an holy resting all the day, not only from such works as are at all times sinful, but even from such worldly employments and recreations as are on other days lawful; and making it our delight to spend the whole time (except so much of it as is to be taken up in works of necessity and mercy) in the public and private exercises of God’s worship: and, to that end, we are to prepare our hearts, and with such foresight, diligence, and moderation, to dispose and seasonably dispatch our worldly business, that we may be the more free and fit for the duties of that day.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第117题

question_zh: 为什么要求我们也使在我们管辖下的人遵守安息日？
question_en: Why is the charge of keeping the sabbath more specially directed to governors of families, and other superiors?
answer_zh: 要求我们也使在我们管辖下的人遵守安息日，因为在我们所管的人中，大部分是忙于为我们服务，如果我们不给他们从工作中得自由的时间，他们自己就无法守安息日；此外，他们守不守安息日，在上帝眼中，我们也有一份责任。
answer_en: The charge of keeping the sabbath is more specially directed to governors of families, and other superiors, because they are bound not only to keep it themselves, but to see that it be observed by all those that are under their charge; and because they are prone ofttimes to hinder them by employments of their own.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第118题

question_zh: 第四条诫命对什么人尤其适用？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the fourth commandment?
answer_zh: 第四条诫命对于家庭中或其他团体中有权柄的人尤其适用，因为他们不仅自己当遵守安息日，也当使在他们管辖下的人遵守安息日。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the fourth commandment are, all omissions of the duties required, all careless, negligent, and unprofitable performing of them, and being weary of them; all profaning the day by idleness, and doing that which is in itself sinful; and by all needless works, words, and thoughts, about our worldly employments and recreations.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第119题

question_zh: 第四条诫命有什么附加的理由来加强其约束力？
question_en: What are the reasons annexed to the fourth commandment, the more to enforce it?
answer_zh: 第四条诫命有附加的理由来加强其约束力，就是上帝允许我们用六天来做自己的事，祂对第七天主张独占的权利，又以自己的榜样为标准，并赐福安息日。
answer_en: The reasons annexed to the fourth commandment, the more to enforce it, are taken from the equity of it, God allowing us six days of seven for our own affairs, and reserving but one for himself, in these words, Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work: from God’s challenging a special propriety in that day, The seventh day is the sabbath of the LORD thy God: from the example of God, who in six days ... made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: and from that blessing which God put upon that day, not only in sanctifying it to be a day for his service, but in ordaining it to be a means of blessing to us in our sanctifying it; Wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第120题

question_zh: 为什么在第四条诫命中用“你”来强调？
question_en: Why is the word Remember set in the beginning of the fourth commandment?
answer_zh: 在第四条诫命中用“你”来强调，因为虽然安息日是使所有人都获益的，但每个人当特别留意遵守安息日，不仅为自己，也当尽力使在自己管辖下的人遵守安息日。
answer_en: The word Remember is set in the beginning of the fourth commandment, partly, because of the great benefit of remembering it, we being thereby helped in our preparation to keep it, and, in keeping it, better to keep all the rest of the commandments, and to continue a thankful remembrance of the two great benefits of creation and redemption, which contain a short abridgment of religion; and partly, because we are very ready to forget it, for that there is less light of nature for it, and yet it restraineth our natural liberty in things at other times lawful; that it cometh but once in seven days, and many worldly businesses come between, and too often take off our minds from thinking of it, either to prepare for it, or to sanctify it; and that Satan with his instruments much labor to blot out the glory, and even the memory of it, to bring in all irreligion and impiety.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第121题

question_zh: 论到我们对人的责任，后六条诫命的总纲是什么？
question_en: What is the sum of the six commandments which contain our duty to man?
answer_zh: 后六条诫命论到我们对人的责任，其总纲就是：要爱人如己，你愿意别人怎样待你，你也要怎样待别人。
answer_en: The sum of the six commandments which contain our duty to man, is, to love our neighbor as ourselves, and to do to others what we would have them do to us.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第122题

question_zh: 第五条诫命是什么？
question_en: Which is the fifth commandment?
answer_zh: 第五条诫命是：“当孝敬父母，使你的日子在耶和华你上帝所赐你的地上得以长久。”
answer_en: The fifth commandment is, Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第123题

question_zh: 第五条诫命中的“父母”是指谁？
question_en: Who are meant by father and mother in the fifth commandment?
answer_zh: 第五条诫命中的“父母”不仅指生身的父母，也指一切在年龄和恩赐上超过我们的人，特别是按照上帝的旨意在我们之上有权柄的人，无论是在家庭中、在教会中，还是在国家中。
answer_en: By father and mother , in the fifth commandment, are meant, not only natural parents, but all superiors in age and gifts; and especially such as, by God’s ordinance, are over us in place of authority, whether in family, church, or commonwealth.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第124题

question_zh: 既然全人类只有两个性别，为什么第五条诫命用“父母”来指称所有的上位者？
question_en: Why are superiors styled Father and Mother?
answer_zh: 第五条诫命用“父母”来指称所有上位者，是为了教导在一切上位者身上，如同在亲生父母身上一样，都应当具有对下位者如父如母的慈爱；也为了使下位者更加乐意并甘心顺服他们，如同顺服亲生的父母一样。
answer_en: Superiors are styled Father and Mother , both to teach them in all duties toward their inferiors, like natural parents, to express love and tenderness to them, according to their several relations; and to work inferiors to a greater willingness and cheerfulness in performing their duties to their superiors, as to their parents.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第125题

question_zh: 第五条诫命的总纲是什么？
question_en: What is the general scope of the fifth commandment?
answer_zh: 第五条诫命的总纲要求，我们按照各人不同的关系，履行对上位者、下位者和同位者所当尽的本分。
answer_en: The general scope of the fifth commandment is, the performance of those duties which we mutually owe in our several relations, as inferiors, superiors or equals.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第126题

question_zh: 下位者对上位者当尽什么本分？
question_en: What is the honor that inferiors owe to their superiors?
answer_zh: 下位者对上位者当尽的本分包括：心里和行为上一切当有的敬重；祈祷和感恩，为着他们的好处；效法他们合法的命令和劝勉；甘心顺服他们合法的命令；对他们的纠正忠心服从；即使在他们做事不够理想的时候，也忠心为他们效力，维护他们的人格和权柄；甘心忍受他们的软弱，以爱遮盖他们的不足，使他们的人格和权柄不受羞辱。
answer_en: The honor which inferiors owe to their superiors is, all due reverence in heart, word, and behavior; prayer and thanksgiving for them; imitation of their virtues and graces; willing obedience to their lawful commands and counsels; due submission to their corrections; fidelity to, defense, and maintenance of their persons and authority, according to their several ranks, and the nature of their places; bearing with their infirmities, and covering them in love, that so they may be an honor to them and to their government.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第127题

question_zh: 下位者对上位者的过犯是什么？
question_en: What are the sins of inferiors against their superiors?
answer_zh: 下位者对上位者的过犯包括：忽视对他们所当尽的本分；嫉妒、轻蔑、反抗他们的人格和地位；咒诅和嘲笑他们以及他们的劝告、命令和纠正；诅咒和毁谤他们，以及与他们有关的事。
answer_en: The sins of inferiors against their superiors are, all neglect of the duties required toward them; envying at, contempt of, and rebellion against their persons and places, in their lawful counsels, commands, and corrections; cursing, mocking, and all such refractory and scandalous carriage, as proves a shame and dishonor to them and their government.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第128题

question_zh: 上位者对下位者当尽什么本分？
question_en: What is required of superiors towards their inferiors?
answer_zh: 上位者对下位者当尽的本分包括：按照从上帝所领受的权能和按照各人的身份，爱他们、为他们祈祷、给他们祝福；教导、劝勉和警戒他们；嘉奖、赏赐那些行善的人，责备那些作恶的人；保护他们，供给他们一切身体上和灵魂上的需要；另外，要庄重、温和、公正、恩慈地待他们；不做过于严厉、令他们沮丧、激怒他们、或使他们受到不必要伤害的事。
answer_en: It is required of superiors, according to that power they receive from God, and that relation wherein they stand, to love, pray for, and bless their inferiors; to instruct, counsel, and admonish them; countenancing, commending, and rewarding such as do well; and discountenancing, reproving, and chastising such as do ill; protecting, and providing for them all things necessary for soul and body: and by grave, wise, holy, and exemplary carriage, to procure glory to God, honor to themselves, and so to preserve that authority which God hath put upon them.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第129题

question_zh: 上位者的过犯是什么？
question_en: What are the sins of superiors?
answer_zh: 上位者的过犯包括：忽视对下位者所当尽的本分；追求私利、私名、私乐；以不合法的方式命令他们做事或禁止他们行善；以不合法的方式激怒他们或纵容他们；灰心使他们的人格受到羞辱；不公正地管辖他们或忽视他们；以及做任何使自己不配得到他们应有之尊敬的事。
answer_en: The sins of superiors are, besides the neglect of the duties required of them, an inordinate seeking of themselves, their own glory, ease, profit, or pleasure; commanding things unlawful, or not in the power of inferiors to perform; counseling, encouraging, or favoring them in that which is evil; dissuading, discouraging, or discountenancing them in that which is good; correcting them unduly; careless exposing, or leaving them to wrong, temptation, and danger; provoking them to wrath; or any way dishonoring themselves, or lessening their authority, by an unjust, indiscreet, rigorous, or remiss behavior.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第130题

question_zh: 同位者的本分是什么？
question_en: What are the duties of equals?
answer_zh: 同位者的本分是：彼此看重各人的尊严和价值；互相尊重；凡事看别人比自己强。
answer_en: The duties of equals are, to regard the dignity and worth of each other, in giving honor to go one before another; and to rejoice in each others’ gifts and advancement, as their own.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第131题

question_zh: 同位者的过犯是什么？
question_en: What are the sins of equals?
answer_zh: 同位者的过犯包括：忽视对他们所当尽的本分；嫉妒别人的恩赐；因别人蒙福便悲伤，因别人受苦便喜乐；轻看同位者，以自己为中心；不正当地高抬自己而贬低他人。
answer_en: The sins of equals are, besides the neglect of the duties required, the undervaluing of the worth, envying the gifts, grieving at the advancement or prosperity one of another; and usurping preeminence one over another.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第132题

question_zh: 第五条诫命附加的理由是什么？
question_en: What is the reason annexed to the fifth commandment, the more to enforce it?
answer_zh: 第五条诫命附加的理由是应许说：“使你的日子在耶和华你上帝所赐你的地上得以长久。”就是应许那些遵守此诫的人长寿昌盛，只要这符合上帝的荣耀和他们自己的益处。
answer_en: The reason annexed to the fifth commandment, in these words, That thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee , is an express promise of long life and prosperity, as far as it shall serve for God’s glory and their own good, to all such as keep this commandment.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第133题

question_zh: 第六条诫命是什么？
question_en: Which is the sixth commandment?
answer_zh: 第六条诫命是：“不可杀人。”
answer_en: The sixth commandment is, Thou shalt not kill.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第134题

question_zh: 第六条诫命吩咐什么？
question_en: What are the duties required in the sixth commandment?
answer_zh: 第六条诫命吩咐一切合法的努力来保全自己和他人的生命；抵制一切谋害生命的思想和意图；节制怒气；饮食有节、劳逸有度、心灵平和、言语温柔、行为仁慈；保护和维护无辜者的生命。
answer_en: The duties required in the sixth commandment are, all careful studies, and lawful endeavors, to preserve the life of ourselves and others by resisting all thoughts and purposes, subduing all passions, and avoiding all occasions, temptations, and practices, which tend to the unjust taking away the life of any; by just defense thereof against violence, patient bearing of the hand of God, quietness of mind, cheerfulness of spirit; a sober use of meat, drink, physic, sleep, labor, and recreations; by charitable thoughts, love, compassion, meekness, gentleness, kindness; peaceable, mild and courteous speeches and behavior; forbearance, readiness to be reconciled, patient bearing and forgiving of injuries, and requiting good for evil; comforting and succoring the distressed, and protecting and defending the innocent.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第135题

question_zh: 第六条诫命禁止什么？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the sixth commandment?
answer_zh: 第六条诫命禁止夺去自己或他人的生命，除非是合法的公共司法、正义的战争或正当的防卫；还禁止忽视或放弃合法的手段来保全生命；以及不正当的怒气、仇恨、嫉妒、报复的心；一切过分的忧虑、不节制的饮食、过度的劳碌、不合理的娱乐；挑衅的话语、欺压、争吵、殴打、伤害，以及一切倾向于不义地毁灭他人生命的行为。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the sixth commandment are, all taking away the life of ourselves, or of others, except in case of public justice, lawful war, or necessary defense; the neglecting or withdrawing the lawful and necessary means of preservation of life; sinful anger, hatred, envy, desire of revenge; all excessive passions, distracting cares; immoderate use of meat, drink, labor, and recreations; provoking words, oppression, quarreling, striking, wounding, and whatsoever else tends to the destruction of the life of any.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第136题

question_zh: 第七条诫命是什么？
question_en: Which is the seventh commandment?
answer_zh: 第七条诫命是：“不可奸淫。”
answer_en: The seventh commandment is, Thou shalt not commit adultery.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第137题

question_zh: 第七条诫命吩咐什么？
question_en: What are the duties required in the seventh commandment?
answer_zh: 第七条诫命吩咐在心灵、言语和行为上保守贞洁；在自己和他人身上保守贞洁；留心看守眼目和一切感官；节制、保持纯洁的交往、端庄的衣着、婚姻之人的彼此相爱和同居；勤劳的工作；节制饮食；远避不洁的交际；压制一切不洁的情欲。
answer_en: The duties required in the seventh commandment are, chastity in body, mind, affections, words, and behavior; and the preservation of it in ourselves and others; watchfulness over the eyes and all the senses; temperance, keeping of chaste company, modesty in apparel; marriage by those that have not the gift of continency, conjugal love, and cohabitation; diligent labor in our callings; shunning all occasions of uncleanness, and resisting temptations thereunto.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第138题

question_zh: 第七条诫命禁止什么？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the seventh commandment?
answer_zh: 第七条诫命禁止一切违反贞洁的思想、意图和情感；一切不洁的言语沟通；不看不洁净的东西；轻浮的行为、不端庄的衣着；禁止不合法的婚姻、以及一切许可或容忍卖淫的行为；不合理地拖延婚姻；同时拥有多个配偶；不正当的离婚或遗弃；懒惰、饱食、醉酒；不洁净的交往；淫荡的歌曲、书籍、图画、舞蹈、演戏以及一切引诱不洁的事物。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the seventh commandment, besides the neglect of the duties required, are, adultery, fornication, rape, incest, sodomy, and all unnatural lusts; all unclean imaginations, thoughts, purposes, and affections; all corrupt or filthy communications, or listening thereunto; wanton looks, impudent or light behavior, immodest apparel; prohibiting of lawful, and dispensing with unlawful marriages; allowing, tolerating, keeping of stews, and resorting to them; entangling vows of single life, undue delay of marriage; having more wives or husbands than one at the same time; unjust divorce, or desertion; idleness, gluttony, drunkenness, unchaste company; lascivious songs, books, pictures, dancings, stage plays; and all other provocations to, or acts of uncleanness, either in ourselves or others.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第139题

question_zh: 第八条诫命是什么？
question_en: Which is the eighth commandment?
answer_zh: 第八条诫命是：“不可偷盗。”
answer_en: The eighth commandment is, Thou shalt not steal.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第140题

question_zh: 第八条诫命吩咐什么？
question_en: What are the duties required in the eighth commandment?
answer_zh: 第八条诫命吩咐我们合法地获取、增加和使用自己和他人的外在财物；真实、正直地对待人；归还欠人的财物；把多余的给予穷人；并且在合法的事业中勤勉劳动，节俭度日。
answer_en: The duties required in the eighth commandment are, truth, faithfulness, and justice in contracts and commerce between man and man; rendering to every one his due; restitution of goods unlawfully detained from the right owners thereof; giving and lending freely, according to our abilities, and the necessities of others; moderation of our judgments, wills, and affections concerning worldly goods; a provident care and study to get, keep, use, and dispose these things which are necessary and convenient for the sustentation of our nature, and suitable to our condition; a lawful calling, and diligence in it; frugality; avoiding unnecessary lawsuits, and suretiship, or other like engagements; and an endeavor, by all just and lawful means, to procure, preserve, and further the wealth and outward estate of others, as well as our own.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第141题

question_zh: 第八条诫命禁止什么？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the eighth commandment?
answer_zh: 第八条诫命禁止凡是有碍于我们自己或邻舍在财物方面获得合法利益的行为；偷盗、抢劫、贩卖人口和接受赃物；欺诈、虚假的度量衡、移动地界；在交易、债务和信托方面的不义和不信；勒索、敲诈；以及一切不正当的手段，如诉讼、贿赂等来获取或保有他人的财物；贪婪、过度追求并过分执著于世俗的财物；使他人无法正当地获取和使用其财物的不信和不义的手段。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the eighth commandment, besides the neglect of the duties required, are, theft, robbery, man-stealing, and receiving anything that is stolen; fraudulent dealing, false weights and measures, removing landmarks, injustice and unfaithfulness in contracts between man and man, or in matters of trust; oppression, extortion, usury, bribery, vexatious lawsuits, unjust enclosures and depredation; engrossing commodities to enhance the price; unlawful callings, and all other unjust or sinful ways of taking or withholding from our neighbor what belongs to him, or of enriching ourselves; covetousness; inordinate prizing and affecting worldly goods; distrustful and distracting cares and studies in getting, keeping, and using them; envying at the prosperity of others; as likewise idleness, prodigality, wasteful gaming; and all other ways whereby we do unduly prejudice our own outward estate, and defrauding ourselves of the due use and comfort of that estate which God hath given us.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第142题

question_zh: 第九条诫命是什么？
question_en: Which is the ninth commandment?
answer_zh: 第九条诫命是：“不可作假见证陷害人。”
answer_en: The ninth commandment is, Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbour.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第143题

question_zh: 第九条诫命吩咐什么？
question_en: What are the duties required in the ninth commandment?
answer_zh: 第九条诫命吩咐我们维护和促进人与人之间的诚实，以及我们自己和邻舍的好名声；特别是在作见证的时候说真话，全部的真话，只说真话；并且从心里、诚恳地、自由地、清楚地说真话；为真理的利益和我们自己及邻舍的好名声；甘心承认自己的罪、无能和不足，为此忧伤；善意地解读邻舍的言行；喜欢和关注自己及他人的好名声，并为此作见证和维护；只接受好的报告；不鼓励搬弄是非的人、谄媚的人和诽谤者。
answer_en: The duties required in the ninth commandment are, the preserving and promoting of truth between man and man, and the good name of our neighbor, as well as our own; appearing and standing for the truth; and from the heart, sincerely, freely, clearly, and fully, speaking the truth, and only the truth, in matters of judgment and justice, and in all other things whatsoever; a charitable esteem of our neighbors; loving, desiring, and rejoicing in their good name; sorrowing for and covering of their infirmities; freely acknowledging of their gifts and graces, defending their innocency; a ready receiving of a good report, and unwillingness to admit of an evil report, concerning them; discouraging talebearers, flatterers, and slanderers; love and care of our own good name, and defending it when need requireth; keeping of lawful promises; studying and practicing of whatsoever things are true, honest, lovely, and of good report.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第144题

question_zh: 第九条诫命禁止什么？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the ninth commandment?
answer_zh: 第九条诫命禁止一切损害真理以及我们自己和邻舍好名声的事；特别是在公共审判中作假见证、教唆或帮助作假见证；知情而沉默、不为无辜者辩护、不为正义的事作见证；发表未经证实的意见；忽视好的名声或采取不利于好名声的行动；下达不公义的判决；定无辜者为有罪，开释有罪的人；按照外貌断定人；过分赞扬或贬低人；向人隐瞒真相；不必要地揭露人的过错；散布假消息、接受和附和恶意的报告；塞耳不听公正的辩护；心怀恶意的猜疑；嫉妒别人应得的赞誉；力图败坏别人的名声；以及喜悦别人的羞辱和恶名。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the ninth commandment are, all prejudicing the truth, and the good name of our neighbors, as well as our own, especially in public judicature; giving false evidence, suborning false witnesses, wittingly appearing and pleading for an evil cause, outfacing and overbearing the truth; passing unjust sentence, calling evil good, and good evil; rewarding the wicked according to the work of the righteous, and the righteous according to the work of the wicked; forgery, concealing the truth, undue silence in a just cause, and holding our peace when iniquity calleth for either a reproof from ourselves, or complaint to others; speaking the truth unseasonably, or maliciously to a wrong end, or perverting it to a wrong meaning, or in doubtful or equivocal expressions, to the prejudice of the truth or justice; speaking untruth, lying, slandering, backbiting, detracting, talebearing, whispering, scoffing, reviling, rash, harsh, and partial censuring; misconstructing intentions, words, and actions; flattering, vainglorious boasting, thinking or speaking too highly or too meanly of ourselves or others; denying the gifts and graces of God; aggravating smaller faults; hiding, excusing, or extenuating of sins, when called to a free confession; unnecessary discovering of infirmities; raising false rumors, receiving and countenancing evil reports, and stopping our ears against just defense; evil suspicion; envying or grieving at the deserved credit of any; endeavoring or desiring to impair it, rejoicing in their disgrace and infamy; scornful contempt, fond admiration; breach of lawful promises; neglecting such things as are of good report, and practicing, or not avoiding ourselves, or not hindering what we can in others, such things as procure an ill name.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第145题

question_zh: 第十条诫命是什么？
question_en: Which is the tenth commandment?
answer_zh: 第十条诫命是：“不可贪恋人的房屋；也不可贪恋人的妻子、仆婢、牛驴，并他一切所有的。”
answer_en: The tenth commandment is, Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is thy neighbour’s.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第146题

question_zh: 第十条诫命吩咐什么？
question_en: What are the duties required in the tenth commandment?
answer_zh: 第十条诫命吩咐我们完全满足于自己的境况，对邻舍及其一切所有的，怀着正当的和仁爱的心态。
answer_en: The duties required in the tenth commandment are, such a full contentment with our own condition, and such a charitable frame of the whole soul toward our neighbor, as that all our inward motions and affections touching him, tend unto, and further all that good which is his.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第147题

question_zh: 第十条诫命禁止什么？
question_en: What are the sins forbidden in the tenth commandment?
answer_zh: 第十条诫命禁止对自己的产业不满；嫉妒或因邻舍的好处忧伤；以及对属于邻舍之物有一切不当的行动或情感。
answer_en: The sins forbidden in the tenth commandment are, discontentment with our own estate; envying and grieving at the good of our neighbor, together with all inordinate motions and affections to anything that is his.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第148题

question_zh: 有没有人能完全遵守上帝的诫命？
question_en: Is any man able perfectly to keep the commandments of God?
answer_zh: 今生没有人能完全遵守上帝的诫命，而是天天在思想、言语和行为上违犯。
answer_en: No man is able, either of himself, or by any grace received in this life, perfectly to keep the commandments of God; but doth daily break them in thought, word, and deed.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第149题

question_zh: 一切违犯上帝律法的罪在上帝眼中都是同等严重的吗？
question_en: Are all transgressions of the law of God equally heinous in themselves, and in the sight of God?
answer_zh: 一切违犯上帝律法的罪并非同等严重；有些罪就其本身而言，或因为若干加重的情节，在上帝看来比其他的罪更为可恶。
answer_en: All transgressions of the law are not equally heinous; but some sins in themselves, and by reason of several aggravations, are more heinous in the sight of God than others.
notes_zh: 大要理问答第150题

question_zh: 使某些罪比其他罪更加严重的加重情节有哪些？
question_en: What are those aggravations that make some sins more heinous than others?
answer_zh: 罪的加重情节来自：一、犯罪者的身份——若他们是成年人、经验丰富、恩赐超群、地位显要、蒙恩更多、职分特殊，是为他人作引导和榜样的人；二、被得罪的对象——若直接得罪神、得罪祂的属性和敬拜；得罪基督和祂的恩典；得罪圣灵、祂的见证和作为；得罪长官、父母和其他在上的人；得罪教会中的圣徒；得罪公众的利益，或许多人的利益；三、犯罪的性质和特征——若违犯律法的明文规定、破坏许多诫命、不仅在外表行为上犯罪且在内心意念上犯罪；不仅是疏忽之罪且是故意之罪；不仅是出于无知的罪且是明知故犯；不仅是偶然之罪且是蓄意之罪、习惯之罪、顽梗之罪、公开之罪；四、犯罪的时间和场合——若在主日、在公开或私下的敬拜中、在蒙恩之后立刻犯罪、在受责备之后犯罪、在领受圣餐之后犯罪。凡此种种以及类似的情形，都使罪更加严重。
answer_en: Sins receive their aggravations, 1. From the persons offending; if they be of riper age, greater experience or grace, eminent for profession, gifts, place, office, guides to others, and whose example is likely to be followed by others. 2. From the parties offended: if immediately against God, his attributes, and worship; against Christ, and his grace; the Holy Spirit, his witness, and workings; against superiors, men of eminency, and such as we stand especially related and engaged unto; against any of the saints, particularly weak brethren, the souls of them, or any other, and the common good of all or many. 3. From the nature and quality of the offence: if it be against the express letter of the law, break many commandments, contain in it many sins: if not only conceived in the heart, but breaks forth in words and actions, scandalize others, and admit of no reparation: if against means, mercies, judgments, light of nature, conviction of conscience, public or private admonition, censures of the church, civil punishments; and our prayers, purposes, promises, vows, covenants, and engagements to God or men: if done deliberately, willfully, presumptuously, impudently, boastingly, maliciously, frequently, obstinately, with delight, continuance, or relapsing after repentance. 4. From circumstances of time, and place: if on the Lord’s day, or other times of divine worship; or immediately before or after these, or other helps to prevent or remedy such miscarriages: if in public, or in the presence of others, who are thereby likely to be provoked or defiled.
notes_zh: 此问提醒我们，罪的严重性不仅在于行为本身，还在于犯罪者的身份、对象、性质和时机。蒙恩越多、知道越多，责任也越大。

question_zh: 每一条罪在神面前应受什么报应？
question_en: What doth every sin deserve at the hands of God?
answer_zh: 每一条罪，即使是最小的罪，因为违背了神的主权、良善和圣洁，违背了祂公义的律法，所以应受神今生和来世的忿怒和咒诅，若非基督的满足，就无法得赦免。
answer_en: Every sin, even the least, being against the sovereignty, goodness, and holiness of God, and against his righteous law, deserveth his wrath and curse, both in this life, and that which is to come; and cannot be expiated but by the blood of Christ.
notes_zh: 即使是最微小的罪也触犯了无限圣洁的神。唯有基督的代赎才能满足神的公义，使罪人得蒙赦免。

question_zh: 神要求什么才能使我们逃脱祂因罪而发的忿怒和咒诅？
question_en: What doth God require of us, that we may escape his wrath and curse due to us by reason of the transgression of the law?
answer_zh: 为使我们逃脱神因罪而发的忿怒和咒诅，神要求我们向神悔改、信靠主耶稣基督，并殷勤使用基督借以将救赎恩惠传递给我们的外在蒙恩之道。
answer_en: That we may escape the wrath and curse of God due to us by reason of the transgression of the law, he requireth of us repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ, and the diligent use of the outward means whereby Christ communicates to us the benefits of his mediation.
notes_zh: 逃避神忿怒的途径不是靠行为，而是悔改、信心与忠心使用蒙恩之道（即圣道、圣礼和祷告）。

question_zh: 基督借以将救赎恩惠传递给我们的外在蒙恩之道是什么？
question_en: What are the outward means whereby Christ communicates to us the benefits of his mediation?
answer_zh: 基督借以将救赎恩惠传递给祂教会的外在和普通蒙恩之道，就是祂所有的典章制度，尤其是圣道、圣礼和祷告；这一切对选民的得救都有功效。
answer_en: The outward and ordinary means whereby Christ communicates to his church the benefits of his mediation, are all his ordinances; especially the word, sacraments, and prayer; all which are made effectual to the elect for their salvation.
notes_zh: 蒙恩之道是神所设立的管道，圣灵借此将基督的救赎应用在信徒身上。我们当珍惜并忠心使用这些恩典管道。

question_zh: 圣道是怎样成为得救的蒙恩之道的？
question_en: How is the word made effectual to salvation?
answer_zh: 圣灵使圣道的宣读，尤其是圣道的宣讲，成为使罪人知罪归正、在圣洁和安慰中得造就、藉信心以致得救的有效蒙恩之道。
answer_en: The Spirit of God maketh the reading, but especially the preaching of the word, an effectual means of enlightening, convincing, and humbling sinners; of driving them out of themselves, and drawing them unto Christ; of conforming them to his image, and subduing them to his will; of strengthening them against temptations and corruptions; of building them up in grace, and establishing their hearts in holiness and comfort through faith unto salvation.
notes_zh: 神的话语本身带着能力，但需要圣灵的内在工作才能使之在人心中产生果效。讲道因此是教会最重要的事工之一。

question_zh: 圣道不是要由每一个人都来宣读吗？
question_en: Is the Word of God to be read by all?
answer_zh: 圣道虽然不是要由每一个人都来公开宣读，但各种年龄的人都当殷勤地私下阅读和研究圣经。
answer_en: Although all are not to be permitted to read the word publicly to the congregation, yet all sorts of people are bound to read it apart by themselves, and with their families: to which end, the holy Scriptures are to be translated out of the original into vulgar languages.
notes_zh: 公开宣读圣经是特定职分的责任，但每位信徒都有责任个人读经、研经，好认识神的心意。

question_zh: 神的道当怎样宣读？
question_en: How is the Word of God to be read?
answer_zh: 圣经当以敬畏神的心来宣读，坚信圣经就是神的话语，并带着理解、敬虔、顺服、爱慕和谨慎的态度来领受，好使人因此得以在信心中被建立，以致得救。
answer_en: The holy Scriptures are to be read with an high and reverent esteem of them; with a firm persuasion that they are the very Word of God, and that he only can enable us to understand them; with desire to know, believe, and obey the will of God revealed in them; with diligence, and attention to the matter and scope of them; with meditation, application, self-denial, and prayer.
notes_zh: 读经不仅是知识上的操练，更是心灵的敬拜。当以敬畏和渴慕的心来领受神的话语。

question_zh: 圣道当由谁来宣讲？
question_en: By whom is the Word of God to be preached?
answer_zh: 圣道只当由那些充分恩赐、并经正式按立的人来宣讲。
answer_en: The Word of God is to be preached only by such as are sufficiently gifted, and also duly approved and called to that office.
notes_zh: 讲道是受召并经教会认可之人的职分。这确保了圣道的忠实传讲和教会的良好秩序。

question_zh: 受召宣讲圣道的人当怎样讲道？
question_en: How is the Word of God to be preached by those that are called thereunto?
answer_zh: 受召宣讲圣道的人当殷勤讲道，不是传自己，乃是传基督；出于正确的动机、忠实地将神全备的旨意传明；智慧地按着听众的需要和理解力来调适；热心地出于对神和爱人灵魂的心来传讲；真诚地以神的荣耀和人的归正、造就、得救为目标。
answer_en: They that are called to labor in the ministry of the word, are to preach sound doctrine, diligently, in season and out of season; plainly, not in the enticing words of man’s wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit, and of power; faithfully, making known the whole counsel of God; wisely, applying themselves to the necessities and capacities of the hearers; zealously, with fervent love to God and the souls of his people; sincerely, aiming at his glory, and their conversion, edification, and salvation.
notes_zh: 传道人的使命不是表现自己，而是忠心传讲基督和祂的全备福音。讲道需要忠诚、智慧与火热的心。

question_zh: 听道的人当怎样听道？
question_en: What is required of those that hear the word preached?
answer_zh: 听道的人当殷勤预备自己来领受圣道；听道时存敬畏和祷告的心；以信心和爱心来领受所传讲的；将所听的存记在心里，并在生活中结出果子。
answer_en: It is required of those that hear the word preached, that they attend upon it with diligence, preparation, and prayer; examine what they hear by the Scriptures; receive the truth with faith, love, meekness, and readiness of mind, as the Word of God; meditate, and confer of it; hide it in their hearts, and bring forth the fruit of it in their lives.
notes_zh: 听道不是被动的消遣，而是需要预备心灵、专注聆听、并在生活中切实遵行。

question_zh: 圣礼怎样成为得救的有效蒙恩之道？
question_en: How do the sacraments become effectual means of salvation?
answer_zh: 圣礼之所以成为得救的有效蒙恩之道，不是因为圣礼本身或施行圣礼之人有什么能力，而是唯独借着圣灵的工作和基督的祝福——基督设立了圣礼并吩咐使用圣礼。
answer_en: The sacraments become effectual means of salvation, not by any power in themselves, or any virtue derived from the piety or intention of him by whom they are administered, but only by the working of the Holy Ghost, and the blessing of Christ, by whom they are instituted.
notes_zh: 圣礼的功效不在于外在仪式本身，而在于圣灵借着圣礼在信徒心中的内在工作。

question_zh: 什么是圣礼？
question_en: What is a sacrament?
answer_zh: 圣礼是基督在新约中所设立的圣洁礼仪，其中借着可感知的记号，将基督和新约的恩惠代表出来、印证出来，并施行在信徒身上。
answer_en: A sacrament is an holy ordinance instituted by Christ in his church, to signify, seal, and exhibit unto those that are within the covenant of grace, the benefits of his mediation; to strengthen and increase their faith, and all other graces; to oblige them to obedience; to testify and cherish their love and communion one with another; and to distinguish them from those that are without.
notes_zh: 圣礼是可见的圣道，用有形的记号印证神无形的恩典，坚固信徒的信心。

question_zh: 圣礼的组成部分有哪些？
question_en: What are the parts of a sacrament?
answer_zh: 圣礼的组成部分有二：一是外在的可感知记号，按基督的设立来使用；二是内在的属灵恩典，就是外在记号所表征的。
answer_en: The parts of a sacrament are two; the one an outward and sensible sign, used according to Christ’s own appointment; the other an inward and spiritual grace thereby signified.
notes_zh: 圣礼将属灵的实际与物质的记号联系在一起，帮助我们凭信心把握神的应许。

question_zh: 新约中有几个圣礼？
question_en: How many sacraments hath Christ instituted in his church under the New Testament?
answer_zh: 新约中的圣礼有两个：洗礼和主的圣餐。
answer_en: Under the New Testament Christ hath instituted in his church only two sacraments, baptism and the Lord’s supper.
notes_zh: 基督只设立了洗礼和圣餐两个圣礼，作为祂教会经常性的蒙恩之道。

question_zh: 什么是洗礼？
question_en: What is baptism?
answer_zh: 洗礼是新约的圣礼，其中基督所设立的洗——就是奉父、子、圣灵的名用水施洗——表征并印证受洗者被接入基督里面，在祂的恩惠中有份，并且立约要归属主，单单属于祂。
answer_en: Baptism is a sacrament of the New Testament, wherein Christ hath ordained the washing with water in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost, to be a sign and seal of ingrafting into himself, of remission of sins by his blood, and regeneration by his Spirit; of adoption, and resurrection unto everlasting life; and whereby the parties baptized are solemnly admitted into the visible church, and enter into an open and professed engagement to be wholly and only the Lord’s.
notes_zh: 洗礼不仅是外在的仪式，更是与基督联合、归入祂名下的记号和印证。

question_zh: 洗礼应当给谁施行？
question_en: Unto whom is baptism to be administered?
answer_zh: 洗礼不可施行给任何在有形教会之外的人，直到他们认信基督、顺服祂为止；但信徒的婴孩当受洗礼。
answer_en: Baptism is not to be administered to any that are out of the visible church, and so strangers from the covenant of promise, till they profess their faith in Christ, and obedience to him, but infants descending from parents, either both, or but one of them, professing faith in Christ, and obedience to him, are in that respect within the covenant, and to be baptized.
notes_zh: 洗礼是给信徒及其子女的，因为神恩典之约的应许延及信徒和他们的后裔。

question_zh: 我们当怎样改善我们的洗礼？
question_en: How is baptism to be improved by us?
answer_zh: 我们当终身不断地努力改善洗礼的恩典和义务，尤其在面对试探和遭遇罪恶之时，当以洗礼中我们被接入的约为鼓励和力量，胜过罪恶，在基督里成长；靠着信心从基督的死和复活中支取力量，治死罪恶，活出新生命；又当努力过这样的生活——凭信心行事，使我们的行事为人与洗礼的恩召相称。
answer_en: The needful but much neglected duty of improving our baptism, is to be performed by us all our life long, especially in the time of temptation, and when we are present at the administration of it to others; by serious and thankful consideration of the nature of it, and of the ends for which Christ instituted it, the privileges and benefits conferred and sealed thereby, and our solemn vow made therein; by being humbled for our sinful defilement, our falling short of, and walking contrary to, the grace of baptism, and our engagements; by growing up to assurance of pardon of sin, and of all other blessings sealed to us in that sacrament; by drawing strength from the death and resurrection of Christ, into whom we are baptized, for the mortifying of sin, and quickening of grace; and by endeavoring to live by faith, to have our conversation in holiness and righteousness, as those that have therein given up their names to Christ; and to walk in brotherly love, as being baptized by the same Spirit into one body.
notes_zh: 洗礼不是一次性的仪式，而是我们一生要回顾并活出来的——每日在基督里向罪死、向义活。

question_zh: 什么是主的圣餐？
question_en: What is the Lord’s supper?
answer_zh: 主的圣餐是新约的圣礼，在其中按照基督的设立，将饼和葡萄酒分给人领受，表明祂的死；那按理领受的人，不是以属肉体的方式，乃是以属灵的方式凭信心被基督的身体和血所喂养，领受祂一切的恩惠，以致灵命的长进和在恩典中的成长。
answer_en: The Lord’s supper is a sacrament of the New Testament, wherein, by giving and receiving bread and wine according to the appointment of Jesus Christ, his death is showed forth; and they that worthily communicate feed upon his body and blood, to their spiritual nourishment and growth in grace; have their union and communion with him confirmed; testify and renew their thankfulness, and engagement to God, and their mutual love and fellowship each with other, as members of the same mystical body.
notes_zh: 圣餐是属灵的筵席，信徒凭信心真实地与基督相交，被祂的恩典所喂养和更新。

question_zh: 基督怎样设立了圣餐？
question_en: How hath Christ appointed bread and wine to be given and received in the sacrament of the Lord’s supper?
answer_zh: 基督在被卖的那一夜设立了圣餐：祂拿起饼来，祝谢了，就擘开，递给门徒，说：'你们拿着吃，这是我的身体，为你们舍的。你们应当如此行，为的是记念我。'饭后，祂照样拿起杯来，说：'这杯是用我的血所立的新约。你们每逢喝的时候，要如此行，为的是记念我。'
answer_en: Christ hath appointed the ministers of his word, in the administration of this sacrament of the Lord’s supper, to set apart the bread and wine from common use, by the word of institution, thanksgiving, and prayer; to take and break the bread, and to give both the bread and the wine to the communicants: who are, by the same appointment, to take and eat the bread, and to drink the wine, in thankful remembrance that the body of Christ was broken and given, and his blood shed, for them.
notes_zh: 圣餐的设立直接来自基督自己，在祂受难前夕赐给教会这宝贵的恩典记号。

question_zh: 按理领受圣餐的人怎样以属灵的方式领受基督的身体和血？
question_en: How do they that worthily communicate in the Lord’s supper feed upon the body and blood of Christ therein?
answer_zh: 按理领受圣餐的人，虽然不是以属肉体的方式，却是以属灵和真实的方式凭着信心在圣餐中领受基督和祂一切的恩惠，正如饼和酒喂养人的身体一样。
answer_en: As the body and blood of Christ are not corporally or carnally present in, with, or under the bread and wine in the Lord’s supper, and yet are spiritually present to the faith of the receiver, no less truly and really than the elements themselves are to their outward senses; so they that worthily communicate in the sacrament of the Lord’s supper, do therein feed upon the body and blood of Christ, not after a corporal and carnal, but in a spiritual manner; yet truly and really, while by faith they receive and apply unto themselves Christ crucified, and all the benefits of his death.
notes_zh: 圣餐中的领受是真实的属灵相交，虽然不是肉体的吃喝，却是凭信心真实地领受基督的恩典。

question_zh: 预备领受圣餐的人当怎样预备自己？
question_en: How are they that receive the sacrament of the Lord’s supper to prepare themselves before they come unto it?
answer_zh: 预备领受圣餐的人当省察自己：对基督的身体有无分辨，对基督有无以信心喂养的胃口，对自己的灵命光景、罪恶、需要和长进有无认识；又当省察自己对神的信心、悔改和爱心，对弟兄姐妹的爱和对众人的善意，饶恕那些得罪自己的人，并渴望与基督有新的交通。
answer_en: They that receive the sacrament of the Lord’s supper are, before they come, to prepare themselves thereunto, by examining themselves of their being in Christ, of their sins and wants; of the truth and measure of their knowledge, faith, repentance; love to God and the brethren, charity to all men, forgiving those that have done them wrong; of their desires after Christ, and of their new obedience; and by renewing the exercise of these graces, by serious meditation, and fervent prayer.
notes_zh: 领圣餐前的自省是严肃的属灵操练，帮助我们以敬虔、感恩的心来到主的桌前。

question_zh: 对自己能否配得领受圣餐有疑虑的人，可以来领受圣餐吗？
question_en: May one who doubteth of his being in Christ, or of his due preparation, come to the Lord’s supper?
answer_zh: 对自己能否配得领受圣餐有疑虑的人，虽然觉得自己软弱不配，但若确实渴慕被基督所得着，并存心顺服祂的命令，就可以而且应当来领受圣餐；因为主的圣餐正是为这样的人设立的。
answer_en: One who doubteth of his being in Christ, or of his due preparation to the sacrament of the Lord’s supper, may have true interest in Christ, though he be not yet assured thereof; and in God’s account hath it, if he be duly affected with the apprehension of the want of it, and unfeignedly desires to be found in Christ, and to depart from iniquity: in which case (because promises are made, and this sacrament is appointed, for the relief even of weak and doubting Christians) he is to bewail his unbelief, and labor to have his doubts resolved; and, so doing, he may and ought to come to the Lord’s supper, that he may be further strengthened.
notes_zh: 圣餐不是给完美之人的奖赏，乃是给饥渴慕义之人的恩典。软弱却渴慕基督的人正是圣餐所邀请的。

question_zh: 对自己能否配得领受圣餐有疑虑的人，可否不来领受圣餐？
question_en: May any who profess the faith, and desire to come to the Lord’s supper, be kept from it?
answer_zh: 对自己能否配得领受圣餐有疑虑的人，不可因此就不来领受；乃是应当更加殷勤地运用一切蒙恩之道，好叫自己蒙光照、得坚固，以致可以来领受圣餐。
answer_en: Such as are found to be ignorant or scandalous, notwithstanding their profession of the faith, and desire to come to the Lord’s supper, may and ought to be kept from that sacrament, by the power which Christ hath left in his church, until they receive instruction, and manifest their reformation.
notes_zh: 有疑虑不应成为逃避圣餐的理由，反而应激励我们更加追求与基督亲近，预备好自己来领受。

question_zh: 在领受圣餐时当做什么？
question_en: What is required of them that receive the sacrament of the Lord’s supper in the time of the administration of it?
answer_zh: 在领受圣餐时，当殷勤地等候神使用这一圣礼；注意圣餐中的各个组成部分和行动；以信心分辨主的身体；以感恩的默想喂养基督的身体和血所表征的；省察自己的属灵光景并有相应的回应；以更新对神的感恩和对弟兄的爱来领受。
answer_en: It is required of them that receive the sacrament of the Lord’s supper, that, during the time of the administration of it, with all holy reverence and attention they wait upon God in that ordinance, diligently observe the sacramental elements and actions, heedfully discern the Lord’s body, and affectionately meditate on his death and sufferings, and thereby stir up themselves to a vigorous exercise of their graces; in judging themselves, and sorrowing for sin; in earnest hungering and thirsting after Christ, feeding on him by faith, receiving of his fullness, trusting in his merits, rejoicing in his love, giving thanks for his grace; in renewing of their covenant with God, and love to all the saints.
notes_zh: 领受圣餐时需要专注和信心，不是机械性的仪式，而是与基督真实的灵性相交。

question_zh: 领受圣餐之后当做什么？
question_en: What is the duty of Christians, after they have received the sacrament of the Lord’s supper?
answer_zh: 领受圣餐之后当严肃地省察自己在圣餐中的行为以及从圣餐中所得的恩惠：若感到更新和安慰，就当感谢神，求祂继续保守，警醒防备松懈；若感到没有恩惠，就当更加仔细地省察自己，以悔改和更殷勤地使用蒙恩之道来等候基督。
answer_en: The duty of Christians, after they have received the sacrament of the Lord’s supper, is seriously to consider how they have behaved themselves therein, and with what success; if they find quickening and comfort, to bless God for it, beg the continuance of it, watch against relapses, fulfill their vows, and encourage themselves to a frequent attendance on that ordinance: but if they find no present benefit, more exactly to review their preparation to, and carriage at, the sacrament; in both which, if they can approve themselves to God and their own consciences, they are to wait for the fruit of it in due time: but, if they see they have failed in either, they are to be humbled, and to attend upon it afterwards with more care and diligence.
notes_zh: 圣餐后的反思与感恩是属灵成长的重要一环。无论感受如何，都当以信心仰望基督的应许。

question_zh: 洗礼和主的圣餐在哪些方面是一致的？
question_en: Wherein do the sacraments of baptism and the Lord’s supper agree?
answer_zh: 洗礼和主的圣餐在以下方面是一致的：两者的创设者都是神；两者的属灵内容都是基督和祂的恩惠；两者都是教会的印记和团契的标记；两者都由基督的使者来施行，直到祂再来。
answer_en: The sacraments of baptism and the Lord’s supper agree, in that the author of both is God; the spiritual part of both is Christ and his benefits; both are seals of the same covenant, are to be dispensed by ministers of the gospel, and by none other; and to be continued in the church of Christ until his second coming.
notes_zh: 两个圣礼虽然形式不同，但都指向基督，都是恩典之约的记号和印证。

question_zh: 洗礼和主的圣餐在哪些方面有分别？
question_en: Wherein do the sacraments of baptism and the Lord’s supper differ?
answer_zh: 洗礼和主的圣餐有以下分别：洗礼是用水施行，只行一次，表征我们被接入基督里面并重生；主的圣餐是用饼和酒反复施行，表征并呈现基督作属灵的粮食喂养我们的灵命和成长。洗礼适用于婴孩，圣餐则只适用于那些能够省察自己的人。
answer_en: The sacraments of baptism and the Lord’s supper differ, in that baptism is to be administered but once, with water, to be a sign and seal of our regeneration and ingrafting into Christ, and that even to infants; whereas the Lord’s supper is to be administered often, in the elements of bread and wine, to represent and exhibit Christ as spiritual nourishment to the soul, and to confirm our continuance and growth in him, and that only to such as are of years and ability to examine themselves.
notes_zh: 洗礼标志着恩典之约的开始，圣餐则在信徒的一生中持续喂养和坚固他们。

question_zh: 什么是祷告？
question_en: What is prayer?
answer_zh: 祷告是奉基督的名将我们的愿望呈献给神，求祂赐下合乎祂旨意的事物，承认我们的罪，并感恩地领受祂的怜悯。
answer_en: Prayer is an offering up of our desires unto God, in the name of Christ, by the help of his Spirit; with confession of our sins, and thankful acknowledgement of his mercies.
notes_zh: 祷告是与神交通的核心方式，包括祈求、认罪和感恩，一切都奉基督的名而行。

question_zh: 我们是否只当向神祷告？
question_en: Are we to pray unto God only?
answer_zh: 唯有神能鉴察人心、垂听祷告、赦免罪孽、成就所求；所以我们只当向祂祷告，不可向任何受造之物祷告。
answer_en: God only being able to search the hearts, hear the requests, pardon the sins, and fulfill the desires of all; and only to be believed in, and worshiped with religious worship; prayer, which is a special part thereof, is to be made by all to him alone, and to none other.
notes_zh: 祷告是对神主权和能力的承认。唯有三一真神是祷告的对象，不可向圣徒、天使或任何受造物祷告。

question_zh: 奉基督的名祷告是什么意思？
question_en: What is it to pray in the name of Christ?
answer_zh: 奉基督的名祷告，就是遵从祂的命令，信靠祂的应许，倚靠祂的中保工作来到神面前，从祂得着信心和随之而来的一切恩典；承认我们自己和我们的祷告是不配的，却因基督和祂中保的身份得蒙悦纳。
answer_en: To pray in the name of Christ is, in obedience to his command, and in confidence on his promises, to ask mercy for his sake; not by bare mentioning of his name, but by drawing our encouragement to pray, and our boldness, strength, and hope of acceptance in prayer, from Christ and his mediation.
notes_zh: 奉基督的名祷告不是魔法咒语，而是承认我们唯独靠着基督的中保工作才能来到神面前。

question_zh: 为什么我们要奉基督的名祷告？
question_en: Why are we to pray in the name of Christ?
answer_zh: 人因罪堕落之后，完全不能借自己或任何其他受造之物来到神面前，所以除了基督之外，别无进到神面前的方法。
answer_en: The sinfulness of man, and his distance from God by reason thereof, being so great, as that we can have no access into his presence without a mediator; and there being none in heaven or earth appointed to, or fit for, that glorious work but Christ alone, we are to pray in no other name but his only.
notes_zh: 我们的罪使我们与圣洁的神隔绝，唯有基督是神与人之间的中保和道路。

question_zh: 圣灵怎样帮助我们祷告？
question_en: How doth the Spirit help us to pray?
answer_zh: 我们不知道该怎样祷告，所以圣灵帮助我们的软弱，使我们知道为谁祷告、为何祷告、怎样祷告——照着神的旨意用说不出来的叹息替我们祈求。
answer_en: We not knowing what to pray for as we ought, the Spirit helpeth our infirmities, by enabling us to understand both for whom, and what, and how prayer is to be made; and by working and quickening in our hearts (although not in all persons, nor at all times, in the same measure) those apprehensions, affections, and graces which are requisite for the right performance of that duty.
notes_zh: 祷告不仅是人的努力，更是圣灵在我们里面的工作。祂引导我们按神的旨意祷告。

question_zh: 什么是主祷文？
question_en: For whom are we to pray?
answer_zh: 主祷文是基督教导门徒的祷告，也被称为'我们在天上的父'那篇祷文。
answer_en: We are to pray for the whole church of Christ upon earth; for magistrates, and ministers; for ourselves, our brethren, yea, our enemies; and for all sorts of men living, or that shall live hereafter; but not for the dead, nor for those that are known to have sinned the sin unto death.
notes_zh: 主祷文是基督亲自教导的祷告范本，是所有祷告的模式和指南。

question_zh: 主祷文中有几部分？
question_en: For what things are we to pray?
answer_zh: 主祷文有三部分：前言、祈求和结语。
answer_en: We are to pray for all things tending to the glory of God, the welfare of the church, our own or others’ good; but not for anything that is unlawful.
notes_zh: 主祷文的结构清晰有序，教导我们如何有条理地将各样事情带到神面前。

question_zh: 主祷文的前言教导我们什么？
question_en: How are we to pray?
answer_zh: 主祷文的前言（就是'我们在天上的父'）教导我们：当以圣洁的敬畏和信心来到神面前，如同儿女来到父亲面前；知道祂有能力且愿意帮助我们；又教导我们当与别人一起并为别人祷告。
answer_en: We are to pray with an awful apprehension of the majesty of God, and deep sense of our own unworthiness, necessities, and sins; with penitent, thankful, and enlarged hearts; with understanding, faith, sincerity, fervency, love, and perseverance, waiting upon him, with humble submission to his will.
notes_zh: 称神为'我们的父'既表达了亲密关系，也表达了敬畏之心。这是子女对慈爱天父的信靠呼求。

question_zh: 主祷文的第一个祈求是什么？
question_en: What rule hath God given for our direction in the duty of prayer?
answer_zh: 主祷文的第一个祈求（就是'愿人都尊你的名为圣'）教导我们祈求：神使我们和所有的人都能荣耀祂；使祂在一切彰显祂自己的事上得荣耀；又求祂掌管万事，使万事都归向祂自己的荣耀。
answer_en: The whole Word of God is of use to direct us in the duty of prayer; but the special rule of direction is that form of prayer which our Savior Christ taught his disciples, commonly called The Lord’s prayer.
notes_zh: 祷告首先关注的是神的荣耀而非我们的需要。神的名为圣是一切祈求的首要之事。

question_zh: 主祷文的第二个祈求是什么？
question_en: How is the Lord’s prayer to be used?
answer_zh: 主祷文的第二个祈求（就是'愿你的国降临'）教导我们祈求：撒但的国被消灭，恩典的国度得以扩展，我们自己被引导并保守在恩典之中；荣耀的国度早日降临。
answer_en: The Lord’s prayer is not only for direction, as a pattern, according to which we are to make other prayers; but may also be used as a prayer, so that it be done with understanding, faith, reverence, and other graces necessary to the right performance of the duty of prayer.
notes_zh: 祈求神国降临是求神的统治在人心中、在世界上不断扩展，直到基督荣耀再来。

question_zh: 主祷文的第三个祈求是什么？
question_en: Of how many parts doth the Lord’s prayer consist?
answer_zh: 主祷文的第三个祈求（就是'愿你的旨意行在地上，如同行在天上'）教导我们祈求：神借着祂的恩典使我们能够并且愿意认识、顺服和降服于祂在万事上的旨意，如同天上的众天使所行的一样。
answer_en: The Lord’s prayer consists of three parts; a preface, petitions, and a conclusion.
notes_zh: 顺服神的旨意是基督徒生命的核心。我们祈求在地上效法天上的完全顺服。

question_zh: 主祷文的第四个祈求是什么？
question_en: What doth the preface of the Lord’s prayer teach us?
answer_zh: 主祷文的第四个祈求（就是'我们日用的饮食，今日赐给我们'）教导我们：承认我们今生一切所需都来自神的白白恩赐；没有神的祝福，我们自己一切的努力和所有受造之物都不能维持我们的生存；所以我们祈求神将今生一切所需赐给我们和他人。
answer_en: The preface of the Lord’s prayer (contained in these words, Our Father which art in heaven ) teacheth us, when we pray, to draw near to God with confidence of his fatherly goodness, and our interest therein; with reverence, and all other childlike dispositions, heavenly affections, and due apprehensions of his sovereign power, majesty, and gracious condescension: as also, to pray with and for others.
notes_zh: 这个祈求提醒我们在日常生活中倚靠神的供应，每一天的需要都仰望祂的恩典。

question_zh: 主祷文的第五个祈求是什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the first petition?
answer_zh: 主祷文的第五个祈求（就是'免我们的债，如同我们免了人的债'）教导我们：我们和其他所有的人都犯了罪，亏欠了神的公义，我们自己和他人都不能使我们偿还这最小的一部分罪债；所以我们祈求神出于白白的恩典，藉着基督的满足，赦免我们和其他人的一切罪恶；我们之所以敢如此祈求，乃是因为借着祂的恩典，我们能够从心里饶恕别人。
answer_en: In the first petition (which is, Hallowed be thy name ), acknowledging the utter inability and indisposition that is in ourselves and all men to honor God aright, we pray, that God would by his grace enable and incline us and others to know, to acknowledge, and highly to esteem him, his titles, attributes, ordinances, word, works, and whatsoever he is pleased to make himself known by; and to glorify him in thought, word, and deed: that he would prevent and remove atheism, ignorance, idolatry, profaneness, and whatsoever is dishonorable to him; and, by his overruling providence, direct and dispose of all things to his own glory.
notes_zh: 我们求神赦免我们的罪，也因蒙赦免的恩典而甘心饶恕他人——这两者不可分割。

question_zh: 主祷文的第六个祈求是什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the second petition?
answer_zh: 主祷文的第六个祈求（就是'不叫我们遇见试探，救我们脱离凶恶'）教导我们：因为我们自己极其软弱败坏，又加上撒但和世界不断的试探，所以我们祈求神：保守我们不遇见试探，或在遇见试探时扶持和拯救我们；使撒但、世界和肉体都不能胜过我们。
answer_en: In the second petition (which is, Thy kingdom come ), acknowledging ourselves and all mankind to be by nature under the dominion of sin and Satan, we pray, that the kingdom of sin and Satan may be destroyed, the gospel propagated throughout the world, the Jews called, the fullness of the Gentiles brought in; the church furnished with all gospel officers and ordinances, purged from corruption, countenanced and maintained by the civil magistrate; that the ordinances of Christ may be purely dispensed, and made effectual to the converting of those that are yet in their sins, and the confirming, comforting, and building up of those that are already converted: that Christ would rule in our hearts here, and hasten the time of his second coming, and our reigning with him forever: and that he would be pleased so to exercise the kingdom of his power in all the world, as may best conduce to these ends.
notes_zh: 我们的软弱需要神的保守。这个祈求承认我们无力自保，唯靠神的大能胜过试探。

question_zh: 主祷文的结语教导我们什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the third petition?
answer_zh: 主祷文的结语（就是'因为国度、权柄、荣耀，全是你的，直到永远。阿们'）教导我们：要从唯独属于神的事实来支取祷告的鼓励；并以赞美来结束我们的祷告，将国度、权柄、荣耀归给神；又以'阿们'来确认我们的愿望和祈求得蒙垂听的信心。
answer_en: In the third petition (which is, Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven ), acknowledging that by nature we and all men are not only utterly unable and unwilling to know and to do the will of God, but prone to rebel against his word, to repine and murmur against his providence, and wholly inclined to do the will of the flesh, and of the devil: we pray, that God would by his Spirit take away from ourselves and others all blindness, weakness, indisposedness, and perverseness of heart; and by his grace make us able and willing to know, do, and submit to his will in all things, with the like humility, cheerfulness, faithfulness, diligence, zeal, sincerity, and constancy, as the angels do in heaven.
notes_zh: 祷告以赞美结束，宣告一切权柄和荣耀都归于神。'阿们'是信心的宣告——求必蒙应允。

question_zh: 关于祷告，有哪些特别的规则？
question_en: What do we pray for in the fourth petition?
answer_zh: 关于祷告的特别规则有：为教会和其中的弟兄姐妹祷告；为执政掌权者和传道人祷告；为自己、为仇敌以及为所有活着的人或将要活着的人祷告，但不为死人祷告。
answer_en: In the fourth petition (which is, Give us this day our daily bread ), acknowledging that in Adam, and by our own sin, we have forfeited our right to all the outward blessings of this life, and deserve to be wholly deprived of them by God, and to have them cursed to us in the use of them; and that neither they of themselves are able to sustain us, nor we to merit, or by our own industry to procure them; but prone to desire, get, and use them unlawfully: we pray for ourselves and others, that both they and we, waiting upon the providence of God from day to day in the use of lawful means, may, of his free gift, and as to his fatherly wisdom shall seem best, enjoy a competent portion of them; and have the same continued and blessed unto us in our holy and comfortable use of them, and contentment in them; and be kept from all things that are contrary to our temporal support and comfort.
notes_zh: 基督徒的祷告应当广泛，包括教会、掌权者和所有在世的人，但不包括已死之人。

question_zh: 什么是诗篇歌唱？
question_en: What do we pray for in the fifth petition?
answer_zh: 诗篇歌唱是敬拜神的一部分，就是用心灵和口唇来颂赞神的荣耀。
answer_en: In the fifth petition (which is, Forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors ), acknowledging that we and all others are guilty both of original and actual sin, and thereby become debtors to the justice of God; and that neither we, nor any other creature, can make the least satisfaction for that debt: we pray for ourselves and others, that God of his free grace would, through the obedience and satisfaction of Christ, apprehended and applied by faith, acquit us both from the guilt and punishment of sin, accept us in his Beloved; continue his favor and grace to us, pardon our daily failings, and fill us with peace and joy, in giving us daily more and more assurance of forgiveness; which we are the rather emboldened to ask, and encouraged to expect, when we have this testimony in ourselves, that we from the heart forgive others their offenses.
notes_zh: 歌唱赞美是敬拜不可或缺的部分，是用心灵诚实来荣耀神的美好方式。

question_zh: 我们在主祷文的第六个祈求中祷告什么？
question_en: What do we pray for in the sixth petition?
answer_zh: 主祷文的第六个祈求（就是'不叫我们遇见试探，救我们脱离凶恶'）教导我们祈求：神或者保守我们不遇见试探犯罪，或者在我们受试探时扶持和拯救我们；使撒但、世界和我们自己的肉体都不能引诱我们去犯罪；求神管理万事，使万事都对我们成为圣洁的益处，使我们在一切试炼中得以站立得住，直到最终完全得胜。
answer_en: In the sixth petition (which is, And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil ), acknowledging that the most wise, righteous, and gracious God, for divers holy and just ends, may so order things, that we may be assaulted, foiled, and for a time led captive by temptations; that Satan, the world, and the flesh, are ready powerfully to draw us aside, and ensnare us; and that we, even after the pardon of our sins, by reason of our corruption, weakness, and want of watchfulness, are not only subject to be tempted, and forward to expose ourselves unto temptations, but also of ourselves unable and unwilling to resist them, to recover out of them, and to improve them; and worthy to be left under the power of them; we pray, that God would so overrule the world and all in it, subdue the flesh, and restrain Satan, order all things, bestow and bless all means of grace, and quicken us to watchfulness in the use of them, that we and all his people may by his providence be kept from being tempted to sin; or, if tempted, that by his Spirit we may be powerfully supported and enabled to stand in the hour of temptation; or when fallen, raised again and recovered out of it, and have a sanctified use and improvement thereof: that our sanctification and salvation may be perfected, Satan trodden under our feet, and we fully freed from sin, temptation, and all evil, forever.
notes_zh: 此祈求重申我们全然倚靠神保守的必要。在属灵争战中，唯有神的恩典使我们得以站立。

question_zh: 主祷文的结语教导我们什么？
question_en: What doth the conclusion of the Lord’s prayer teach us?
answer_zh: 主祷文的结语（就是'因为国度、权柄、荣耀，全是你的，直到永远。阿们'）教导我们：在祷告中以赞美为鼓励，将一切归给神；以确定的信心说'阿们'来结束祷告，表明我们的愿望已蒙垂听，必然成就。
answer_en: The conclusion of the Lord’s prayer (which is, For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, forever. Amen. ) teacheth us to enforce our petitions with arguments, which are to be taken, not from any worthiness in ourselves, or in any other creature, but from God; and with our prayers to join praises, ascribing to God alone eternal sovereignty, omnipotency, and glorious excellency; in regard whereof, as he is able and willing to help us, so we by faith are emboldened to plead with him that he would, and quietly to rely upon him, that he will fulfill our requests. And, to testify this our desire and assurance, we say, Amen.
